verses.verse: {Hosea Reconciles with His Wife} d Then the Lord told me: "Go love your wife {Or love a woman} again, even though she is being loved by another and is committing adultery. Love her the same way {Lit. adultery, as} the Lord loves the people of Israel, even though they look to other gods and love raisin cakes." {I. e. cakes used for offerings; cf. 2Sam 6:19}
So I bought her back for myself for fifteen pieces of silver and about ten bushels of barley. {Lit. and one and a half homers}
I told her, "You will remain with me a long time, {Lit. me many days} you won't be promiscuous, you won't be involved with any man, and I'll do the same." {Lit. same with you}

Likewise, the people of Israel will dwell a long time {Lit. will live many days} without a king, without a prince, without sacrifice, without sacred {The Heb. lacks sacred} pillars, and with neither ephod nor teraphim. {I. e. images used for divination}
Afterward, the people of Israel will return and seek the Lord their God and David their king. They will come in awe to the Lord and to his goodness in the last days.
